main.name: Jerry Che
main.occupation: A Master of Science in Information Technology Management Student at UT Austin
bio: Hi, my name is Jerry and I'm from McKinney, TX. I am currently attending the McCombs School of Business at UT Austin studying for a Masters of Science in Information Technology Management. I have just recently graduated with a BBA in Management Information Systems and a certificate in Computer Science in December 2019.

I love sports especially basketball and football. I've been a big fan of Longhorn football since I was young. I'm a huge Dallas Mavericks fan and sometimes reminisce on the good times when Mavericks made it to the finals in 2011 without a super team(*cough* Warriors). In my free time, I try to stay active by working out and playing pick up basketball. I also love outdoor activities. My ideal vacation would be to go somewhere with mountains for some skiing and hiking. I'm also a big fan of Netflix and binge watching shows. My favorite shows of all time are the Office, Parks and Recreation, the 100, Suits, and Game of Thrones.

resume.skillmessage: Listed below is how comfortable I feel with certain technologies

education.degree: Masters of Science in Information Technology Management
Bachelors of Business Adminstration in Management Information Systems, CS Certificate

work.title: MIS 333K Web Development Teaching Assitant
description: Facilitated discussion on Web Development techniques like object-oriented design, MVC architecture, and ASP.NET
Tested back-end functionality of final project to ensure over 100 business requirements have been incorporated
Solved complex debugging problems on web application programs for over 100 students

work.title: Technology Consulting Intern
description: Assessed security of client networks, hosts, and applications to define gaps and recommend risk mitigation techniques
Assisted in integrating Splunk Enterprise into IT architecture to quickly identify and respond to internal and external attacks
Developed a three-year strategy roadmap for one of the largest non-profit organizations raising more than $800 million a year
Conducted physical walkthroughs of hospitals and clinics to ensure HIPPA data security practices are being followed
Utilized the NIST Cybersecurity Framework to develop best-practice policies, procedures, and processes
Interviewed essential personnel to investigate risks and concerns in information security to formulate a report for BOD

work.title: Leasing Agent
description: Prepare and execute leases in accordance with state and local property standards and regulations using Entrata
Perform administrative duties like audits on unpaid balances, processing payments, and communication with 345 tenants
Assist the team in bringing our pre-lease percentage from 60% to 90% through promotional fliers, outreach events, and social media posts
Consulted with over 100 prospective clients about living preferences and conducted tours of select units based on their personal preferences

work.title: Data Analyst Intern
description: Developed Tableau data visualization dashboards to help analyze trends and relationships in data using statistical techniques
Summarized findings in a management report to articulate reasons for success and identify root causes for unsuccessful programs
Gathered and performed data validation checks on information from 10 departments and 100 different programs

academicprojects.title: Austin Diaper Bank
details: Collaborated with a team to integrate Salesforce Non-Profit Cloud into ADB’s existing website for better data management using project management techniques and Agile methodology
Consulted weekly with ADB key stakeholders to communicate weekly project status, increasing scope, and system requirements

academicprojects.title: Bevo's Bookstore
details: Collaborated with a team using Agile methods to engineer a website mimicking an online retailer for books
Designed a database in Azure and integrated it using C# model classes and Entity Framework data migrations
Integrated Identity and Roles-Based authorization into the website for limited functionality and data security

testimonials.text: “It’s Not Whether You Get Knocked Down, It’s Whether You Get Up.”

That Jerry Che must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
